archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: A soldier in the Second Vermont Regiment describes the entire Yorktown campaign of the Civil War. Descriptions include the first encounter with Confederate troops, the retreat to Newport News, and the siege of Yorktown.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Second Vermont Regiment Soldier Letter, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 09/01/2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A soldier in the Second Vermont Regiment describes the entire Yorktown campaign of the Civil War. Descriptions include the first encounter with Confederate troops, the retreat to Newport News, and the siege of Yorktown.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
